intro: Retinispora andelyensis, commonly known as the Andelyense Retinispora, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its bark is smooth and often exhibits a reddish hue, while its wood is lightweight and durable. Retinispora andelyensis plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
